info.description:
| API Documentation |
 |-----|
  |[NHS Digital FHIR Implementation Guide](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home)|


 | FHIR Implementation Guide | Version |
 |-----|-----|
 |[ukcore.release1.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/hl7fhirukcorer4release1/home)|1.2.2-prerelease|
 |[uk.nhsdigital.r4.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home)|2.4.17-prerelease|
 |[uk.nhsdigital.medicines.r4.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/nhsdigital-medicines/home)|2.4.3-prerelease|

tags.name: CapabilityStatement
tags.description:
Resource (schema): [FHIR CapabilityStatement](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/CapabilityStatement.html)

 A Capability Statement documents a set of capabilities (behaviors) of a FHIR Server for a particular version of FHIR that may be used as a statement of actual server functionality or a statement of required or desired server implementation.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-CapabilityStatement](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-CapabilityStatement.guide.md)

tags.name: MessageDefinition
tags.description:
Resource (schema): [FHIR MessageDefinition](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/MessageDefinition.html)

 Defines the characteristics of a message that can be shared between systems, including the type of event that initiates the message, the content to be transmitted and what response(s), if any, are permitted.

 Allows messages to be defined once and re-used across systems.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-MessageDefinition](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-MessageDefinition.guide.md)

tags.name: OperationDefinition
tags.description:
Resource (schema): [FHIR OperationDefinition](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/OperationDefinition.html)

 A formal computable definition of an operation (on the RESTful interface) or a named query (using the search interaction).

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-OperationDefinition](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-OperationDefinition.guide.md)

get.summary: server-capabilities: Fetch the server FHIR CapabilityStatement

get.description:
NHS Validation Service Operation

 ## Parameters (In) 

 |Name | Cardinality | Type | Documentation |
 |-------|-----------|-------------|------------|
 |resource|1..1|DomainResource|The resource to be validated|

 ## Parameters (Out) 

 |Name | Cardinality | Type | Documentation |
 |-------|-----------|-------------|------------|
 |return|1..1|OperationOutcome|response to the event POST|

 ## Comment 

NHS Validation Service Operation

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: The resource to be validated

parameters.name: return
parameters.description: response to the event POST

parameters.name: url
parameters.description:
The uri that identifies the CapabilityStatement [CapabilityStatement](capabilitystatement.html): The uri that identifies the capability statement
| Type | Expression | |--------|--------| | [uri ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#uri)| CapabilityStatement.url |

parameters.name: NHSD-Session-URID
parameters.description: The user role ID (URID) for the current session. Also known as a user role profile ID (URPID).

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the request, which we use to de-duplicate repeated requests and to trace the request if you contact our helpdesk

parameters.name: X-Correlation-ID
parameters.description: An optional ID which you can use to track transactions across multiple systems. It can have any value, but we recommend avoiding `.` characters.

parameters.name: NHSD-Session-URID
parameters.description: The user role ID (URID) for the current session. Also known as a user role profile ID (URPID).

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the request, which we use to de-duplicate repeated requests and to trace the request if you contact our helpdesk

parameters.name: X-Correlation-ID
parameters.description: An optional ID which you can use to track transactions across multiple systems. It can have any value, but we recommend avoiding `.` characters.
